header.$description: modal.border.header — Modal header bottom border. Separates header from body content.

overlay.$description: modal.overlay — Modal overlay/backdrop color. Darker for dark theme to maintain contrast with dark page bg.

0.$description: opacity.0 — Fully transparent (0%). Use for: hidden elements, animation start states, invisible interactive areas. Element is invisible but may still be interactive. CSS: opacity: 0; visibility: hidden for truly hidden.

5.$description: opacity.5 — 5% opacity - barely visible. Use for: extremely subtle hover states, ghost backgrounds, near-invisible separators. Only visible against high-contrast backgrounds.

10.$description: opacity.10 — 10% opacity - subtle transparency. Use for: light hover backgrounds, subtle shadows, faint overlays. Minimally perceptible change.

20.$description: opacity.20 — 20% opacity - light transparency. Use for: hover states, light overlays, muted backgrounds. Noticeable but unobtrusive.

25.$description: opacity.25 — 25% opacity - quarter visible. Use for: skeleton loading states, light dimming, subtle backgrounds. Common for placeholder content.

30.$description: opacity.30 — 30% opacity - moderate transparency. Use for: image overlays, text shadows, moderate dimming. Visible but allows content behind to show clearly.

40.$description: opacity.40 — 40% opacity - semi-transparent. Use for: medium overlays, watermarks, partially hidden content. Balanced visibility.

50.$description: opacity.50 — 50% opacity - half visible. Use for: disabled elements (semantic alias: 'disabled'), balanced overlays, de-emphasized content. CAUTION: May not meet contrast requirements for text.

60.$description: opacity.60 — 60% opacity - mostly visible. Use for: modal backdrops (semantic alias: 'overlay'), dimmed backgrounds, focus-drawing overlays. Content behind is visible but de-emphasized.

70.$description: opacity.70 — 70% opacity - high visibility. Use for: heavy overlays, strong dimming, de-emphasized backgrounds. Most content visible but clearly secondary.

75.$description: opacity.75 — 75% opacity - three-quarters visible. Use for: dark overlays, strong backgrounds, significant dimming. Mostly solid with hint of transparency.

80.$description: opacity.80 — 80% opacity - mostly solid. Use for: nearly-opaque overlays, frosted glass effects (with backdrop-filter), heavy backgrounds.

90.$description: opacity.90 — 90% opacity - nearly solid. Use for: subtle transparency effects, slight see-through, glass-like surfaces. Almost indistinguishable from solid.

100.$description: opacity.100 — Fully opaque (100%). Use for: solid elements, removing inherited transparency, default element state. CSS: opacity: 1; (default browser value).

disabled.$description: opacity.disabled — Disabled element opacity (50%). SEMANTIC alias for opacity.50. Use for: disabled buttons, inactive controls, unavailable options. Universally recognized as 'inactive'. ACCESSIBILITY: Ensure disabled elements are still perceivable and their disabled state is communicated via aria-disabled.

overlay.$description: opacity.overlay — Modal overlay opacity (60%). SEMANTIC alias for opacity.60. Use for: modal backdrops, lightbox backgrounds, focus-drawing overlays. Dims background while keeping it visible for context. Common in: Modal backdrop, Drawer overlay, image lightbox backgrounds.
